00019 #include <stdio.h>
00020 #include <fcntl.h>
00021 #include <stdarg.h>
00022 
00023 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(WIN64)
00024 // setmode function for stdin "binarization"
00025 #include <io.h>
00026 #endif
00027 
00028 #ifndef O_BINARY
00029     #define O_BINARY 0
00030 #endif
00031 
00032 FILE *file_in  = NULL;  // global input file handle
00033 FILE *file_out = NULL;  // global output file handle
00034 int verbose    = 0;     // global verbose level
00035 
00036 static void verbose_print(int level, char *fmt, ...)
00037 {
00038     if (level <= verbose)
00039     {
00040         va_list args;
00041         va_start(args, fmt);
00042         vfprintf(stderr, fmt, args);
00043         va_end(args);
00044     }
00045 }
00046 
00047 static int open_std_files(char *input_file, char *output_file);
00048 static void close_std_files(void);
00049 
00053 static int read_input_file(void *buf, int buf_size);
00054 
00058 static int write_output_file(const void *buf, int buf_size);
00059 
00060 static int rewind_input_file(void);
00061 
00063 static int open_std_files(char *input_file, char *output_file)
00064 {
00065     // input file
00066     if (!input_file)
00067     {
00068         verbose_print(0, "Error: input file not specified\n");
00069         return -1;
00070     }
00071     if (0 == strcmp(input_file, "stdin"))
00072     {
00073         file_in = stdin;
00074 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(WIN64)
00075         _setmode(_fileno(stdin), O_BINARY);
00076 #endif
00077     }
00078     else
00079     {
00080         file_in = fopen(input_file, "rb");
00081     }
00082     if (file_in == NULL)
00083     {
00084         verbose_print(0, "Error: can't open input file [%s]\n", input_file);
00085         return -1;
00086     }
00087     // output file
00088     if (output_file)
00089     {
00090         if (0 == strcmp(output_file, input_file))
00091         {
00092             verbose_print(0, "Error: attempt to write to input file [%s]\n", input_file);
00093             return -1;
00094         }
00095         if (0 == strcmp(output_file, "stdout"))
00096         {
00097             file_out = stdout;
00098 #if defined(WIN32) || defined(WIN64)
00099             _setmode(_fileno(stdout), O_BINARY);
00100 #endif
00101         }
00102         else
00103         {
00104             file_out = fopen(output_file, "wb");
00105         }
00106         if (file_out == NULL)
00107         {
00108             verbose_print(0, "Error: can't open output file [%s]\n", output_file);
00109             return -1;
00110         }
00111     }
00112     return 0;
00113 }
00114 
00115 static void close_std_files(void)
00116 {
00117     if ((file_in != NULL)  && (file_in != stdin))   fclose(file_in);
00118     if ((file_out != NULL) && (file_out != stdout)) fclose(file_out);
00119 }
00120 
00121 static int read_input_file(void *buf, int buf_size)
00122 {
00123     int bytes = 0;
00124     if (file_in)
00125     {
00126         bytes = (int)fread(buf, 1, buf_size, file_in);
00127     }
00128     return bytes;
00129 }
00130 
00131 static int write_output_file(const void *buf, int buf_size)
00132 {
00133     int bytes = 0;
00134     if (file_out)
00135     {
00136         bytes = (int)fwrite(buf, 1, buf_size, file_out);
00137         if(bytes != buf_size)
00138         {
00139             printf("write file operation failed!!!\n");
00140             exit(-1);
00141         }
00142     }
00143     return bytes;
00144 }
00145 
00146 static int rewind_input_file(void)
00147 {
00148     if (file_in)
00149     {
00150         return fseek(file_in, 0, 0);
00151     }
00152     return -1;
00153 }
